instruction: What metric was chosen to monitor the dynamics of aquatic ecosystems, and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the proposed method is the median absolute percentage difference (MAPD). This metric measures the difference between the Acolite-derived remote sensing reflectance (R-rs) and the ship-based in situ R-rs observations obtained from the Barents Sea waters. The MAPD values range from 9% to 25% in the blue-green bands.

The proposed method significantly reduces uncertainties compared to those in the literature. By applying a new machine learning-based bandpass adjustment (BA) model to near-simultaneous OLI and MSI images, the spectral difference is reduced from approximately 6% to 12% to less than 10% in the common OLI-MSI bands. This reduction in spectral difference indicates a decrease in inconsistencies and uncertainties in the merging of data products from multisensors.

instruction: How does the proposed machine learning-based bandpass adjustment (BA) model compare to the conventional linear adjustment method in terms of spectral merging of OLI and MSI images?
Output: The proposed machine learning-based bandpass adjustment (BA) model is compared to the conventional linear adjustment method in terms of spectral merging of OLI and MSI images. The study demonstrates that the spectral difference is significantly reduced using the proposed BA model. Specifically, the spectral difference is reduced from approximately 6% to 12% to less than 10% in the common OLI-MSI bands. This improvement in spectral merging is significant compared to the conventional linear adjustment method.
